Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior glazed towards outside, reserved in, with added red band between; exterior: narrow black rays around knob (now missing), bounded by two lines; black-figure decoration in outer frieze consisting of female figure (face in added white, fillet in red, and hair remaining), to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit suggests that the sherd might belong to the same vessel as Boston 88.844 (Venit 1982, 343, no. B420), though little seems closely similar.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 343, no. B420)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0790) (Phase 1)
